avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is assessed as low. The few danger spots are located above 2000m in extremely steep, north-facing slopes and gullies that have not yet been unloaded. Spontaneous loose and wet-snow avalanches cannot be ruled out there.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small spontaneous loose and wet-snow avalanches possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed slopes the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: No significant change of the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment: The weather on Thursday is cooler and more unsettled. The mountains are mostly covered in fog and there are some local rain showers. The snowfall level will drop to 2000 m as a north-westerly wind blows from the north. Friday will be cloudy and rainy with a snowfall level between 1600 m and 1900 m.

customData.generalHeadline: Wet snow problem at high altitudes - low avalanche danger!
